metadata.feature_description: Manages URL paths that should be crawled for search indexing, including authentication settings and sitemap configuration

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add new URL path with valid URL

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Search > Crawling tab
steps.expected: URL Paths section should be visible with existing URLs
steps.actual: URL Paths section displayed with 4 existing URLs and Add Url button

steps.expected: Add URL form should appear with all fields
steps.actual: Form expanded showing Url, Sitemap URL, DNN Role Impersonation, Enable Spidering, Windows Authentication fields

steps.action: Enter valid URL 'http://test-crawl-url.example.com' and click Save
steps.expected: URL should be added to the list
steps.actual: URL was successfully added and appears in the URL paths list

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add URL path with empty URL (validation)

steps.action: Open Add URL form and click Save without entering a URL
steps.expected: Validation error should appear for empty URL field
steps.actual: URL field showed red border and exclamation icon indicating validation error

steps.action: Click edit icon on existing URL path (http://localhost:8081)
steps.expected: Edit form should expand with current URL details
steps.actual: Edit form expanded showing URL field, Sitemap URL, DNN Role dropdown, Enable Spidering toggle (On), Windows Authentication toggle (Off)

steps.action: Observe Enable Spidering toggle in edit form
steps.expected: Toggle should be visible and functional
steps.actual: Enable Spidering toggle visible with On/Off states, showing 'On' for localhost:8081 URL

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Configure Windows authentication for URL path

steps.action: Toggle Windows Authentication from Off to On
steps.expected: Windows credential fields should become enabled
steps.actual: Windows Authentication toggle changed to On, Windows Domain/User Account/Password fields became editable (no longer greyed out)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Windows domain, username, and password

steps.action: Enter Windows Domain: TESTDOMAIN, User Account: testuser, Password: TestPassword123
steps.expected: All fields should accept input, password should be masked
steps.actual: Domain and User Account fields showed entered text, Password field showed masked characters (dots)

steps.expected: Dropdown should show available portal roles
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed roles: Administrators, Community Manager, Content Editors, Content Managers, Moderators, Registered Users, Subscribers, Test Custom Role, Translator (en-US), Unverified Users, Wiki Test Group

steps.expected: Role should be selected and displayed
steps.actual: Registered Users was selected and displayed in the dropdown

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add sitemap URL to URL path

steps.expected: Sitemap URL field should accept the URL
steps.actual: Sitemap URL field accepted and displayed the entered URL

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Cancel with unsaved changes shows warning

steps.action: Make changes to form fields and click Cancel
steps.expected: Warning dialog should appear asking to confirm discard of unsaved changes
steps.actual: Dialog appeared: 'You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to continue?' with No and Yes buttons

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Delete URL path and verify removal

steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared: 'Are you sure you want to delete http://test-crawl-url.example.com?' with No and Yes buttons

steps.expected: URL should be removed from the list
steps.actual: URL was successfully deleted and no longer appears in the URL paths list (list now shows 4 URLs instead of 5)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View URL path list and details

steps.action: View URL paths list in Crawling tab
steps.expected: List should display URLs with columns: URL, Enable Spidering, DNN Impersonation, Windows Auth
steps.actual: List displayed all columns correctly with checkboxes indicating enabled states for each URL path

steps.action: Attempt to save URL that already exists in the system
steps.expected: Error message should indicate duplicate URL
steps.actual: Error message displayed: 'URL already exists. Please enter a different URL.'

observations: URL validation only checks for non-empty string (commented regex in code suggests more thorough URL format validation was planned but disabled)
Windows credential fields are properly disabled when Windows Authentication toggle is Off
Password field correctly masks input with dots for security
DNN Role Impersonation dropdown loads portal roles dynamically from the server
Delete confirmation dialog prevents accidental deletion of URL paths
Unsaved changes warning prevents loss of form data when navigating away
